person.persName: Garrett Davis (Kentucky attorney, farmer, and politician)

body.p: Bourbon County, Kentucky, attorney, farmer, and politician. Kentucky native. Married to Rebecca Trimble Davis in Bourbon County, Kentucky, on September 21, 1826. Father of Robert Trimble Davis, Caroline Scott Davis Magowan, and Rebecca T. Davis. Married to Eliza Jane Morrow Davis. Father of Garrett Morrow Davis. Clerk in the Office of the County Clerk in Montgomery County, Kentucky. Clerk in the Office of the County Clerk in Bourbon County. Admitted to the bar in 1823. Attorney in Bourbon County. Member of the House of Representatives for the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Bourbon County from 1833 to 1838. Member of the Whig Party. Member of the House of Representative of the United States from the Twelfth Congressional District of Kentucky from 1839 to 1847. Member of the House of Representative of the United States from the Eighth Congressional District of Kentucky from 1843 to 1847 Delegate to 1849 Kentucky Constitutional Convention from Bourbon County, Kentucky. Attorney in Bourbon County in 1850. Owned nine enslaved people in Bourbon County in 1850. Declined the nomination of the American Party for President of the United States in 1856. Attorney and farmer in Bourbon County in 1860. Owned fifteen enslaved people in Bourbon County in 1860. Member of the Senate of the United States from Kentucky from 1861 to 1872. Regent of the Smithsonian Institution from 1864 to 1872.
